availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William C. Wilson (Pendleton County, KY, hotelkeeper and farmer)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer and hotelkeeper. Son of Agness Wilson. Married to Mary Bogle Vanarsdale Wilson in Pendleton County, Kentucky, on November 11, 1851. Father of William M. Wilson, James F. Wilson, John M. Wilson, and Mary A. Wilson. Stepfather of Frank F. Vanarsdale Wilson. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1850. Hotelkeeper in Pendleton County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, District 1, p. 354A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 496.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, Precinct 1, p. 375A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Pendleton County Marriages, 1830-1858, Film #000272807, p. 409 of 745 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
